title: England and New Zealand are now at the peak of their powers and have given us a semi-final for fans to savour
text:
England and New Zealand's unexpectedly emphatic wins over Australia and Ireland respectively were unmistakable statements of intent by two teams operating at the very peak of their powers. With both Eddie Jones' and Steven Hansen's sides sharing so many attributes and qualities, Saturday's match in Yokohama should be a phenomenal encounter which would have made a wonderful final.

While the end result was strikingly similar, with England winning 40-16 and New Zealand finishing up 46-14 victors, these two sides employed completely different approaches to beating two opponents known for their resilience.

England started off with a lengthy defensive set and gradually worked their way into the game,...
description: England and New Zealand's unexpectedly emphatic wins over Australia and Ireland respectively were unmistakable statements of intent by two teams operating at the very peak of their powers.
